intro: Stigmatorthos peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist climates. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
